moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: from the najdorf tournament. Thanks to enasab i know now better the sicilian.
moves.6... e6: my favorite defense, tending to be able to castle gently or to have good opportunity in the center.
moves.7. Qd2 h6 8. Be3 Ng4: so i can exchange the good bishop for the average knight
moves.11. b4 Be7: I am now ready to castle, which seems frequently difficult for black
moves.12. O-O: white casltling too. Frequently najdorf leeds to o-o-o for white.
moves.13. a4: but white has found a way to disturb me, though
moves.13... bxa4 14. Nxa4 Bd7 15. c4: i guess the idea was to create a hole on queen side
moves.15... Nc6: i have been thinking a good while here
moves.16. b5: excatly because of this move... but it is clearly a mistake... seen why? Because d4 and a1 are on the same diagonal...
moves.18. Qe3 axb5: i could have played the obvious Bxa1 now, but I found out that in that case i only gain a quality and white can have a passed pawn...
moves.21... Bxb5: but it is too late for his pawn then
moves.22. Bxb5 Rxb5 23. h3 Qb8: it is not simple yet now: i only have a quality and a pawn.
moves.24. Ra3: he clearly tells me: go ahead I want to see what you have
moves.26. g3 dxe4: now Qxd4 would meet Qd2 with the necessity to exchange queens.
moves.27... Rb3: well then I exchange the rooks
moves.28. Rxb3 Qxb3 29. Qc5 e3: pawn lost of lost, i dismantle his pawn structure
